methods.decode:
Decode an object from an array of bytes.

:param input: (byte[]) - The input byte array containing bytes to decode
:param offset: (int) - The offset into the byte array to start decoding from
:param length: (int) - The length of the byte array to decode from, starting at the offset
:return: (java.lang.String) The output object, possibly null
methods.encode:
Encode the specified input as an array of bytes.
 Note that it is up to the implementation how to encode null inputs. The use of a zero-length byte array
 (e.g. CollectionUtil.ZERO_LENGTH_BYTE_ARRAY) is strongly encouraged.

:param input: (java.lang.String) - The input object, possibly null
:return: (byte[]) The output byte array
methods.expectedObjectWidth:
What width byte array does this ObjectCodec expect to encode and decode?

:return: (int) VARIABLE_WIDTH_SENTINEL if the codec  must encode and decode variable width columns, otherwise the fixed
 size of byte array that must be decoded and encoded.
methods.getPrecision:
If applicable, the maximum encodable precision. If precision is not applicable (i.e. for non-numeric types)
 this method should return zero.

:return: (int) the numeric precision supported by this codec
methods.getScale:
If applicable, the maximum encodable scale. If scale is not applicable (i.e. for non-numeric types)
 this method should return zero.

:return: (int) the numeric scale (digits after the decimal point) supported by this codec
methods.isNullable:
Does this codec support encoding of null values?

:return: (boolean) if null values are supported

text:
Codec for non-nullable Strings from UTF8 byte arrays.
 One particular instance where this is useful is reading parquet 1.0 data
    encoded as binary as String.
